column4: PROBLEM: Whenever i boot, i get the message that my home directory appears to be /home/cody, but it could not be found, do i want to use / instead? I click no, then it gives me the error: "Users $HOME/.dmrc file is ignored... It should be owned by the user and have 644 permisions. What is wrong?
I am on LiveCD right now
does /home/cody exist? Is user cody the owner?
Both should be yes, i will mount the partition that has /home on it to see if something happened
Would that command still apply since i am on a live cd?
dare I ask what you did to fstab/
so remove it. Sounds like /home is not being mounted.
Okay, how would i do so? I am on the liveCD
mount the hard drive and edit the fstab.
I will be allowed to without being sudo?
you can sudo from the livecd
I found out what happened!!! For some reason, when i had it add the line to fstab, it removed everything else
if you don't have a backup, create it manually.  Use /etc/fstab on the livecd as a guide.
Okay, cause i never expected that hehe I will c/p
Uh oh... i remember mine being very different :(
